title: Spekit
heading: Spekit / Birk Solutions
about:
**Spekit** is a sales platform used primarily by sales agents embedded within the showrooms of Building companies for **creating quotes of product packages**.

 Spekit enables the quick customisation of quotes for sets of products (such as Window furnishings) and enables full **job tracking** and managment functionality for the vendor to utilize from the showroom, all the way through to installation, payment and managing customer dissatisfaction.

technology.description: Spekit is a web application built using enterprise java to implement a **resful backend** paired with a range of **angularjs webapps** to interact and manage information and data. The SVG library Raphael.js is used extensivly to edit and visualise House plan and other product information in a user friendly and accessible way.

badges.name: Angular
badges.description: Javascript MVC/MVVM framework for interactive webapps

badges.name: Java
badges.description: Java RESTful web service for glassfish application server

badges.name: Html 5 / CSS 3
badges.description: Use of modern HTML5 features for best a great user experience

badges.name: Git
badges.description: Version control through Git hosted on private Gitlab insance

badges.name: Raphael.js (svg)
badges.description: Complex house plan manipulation through svg graphic library

badges.name: Jquery
badges.description: Document traversal and manipulation library

achievements.description: My primary accomplishment while working on Spekit was being able to **demonstrate the skills** I learned at university while **autonomously completing** further development of my technical skills as required. It was a very satisfying experience being able to work on software used to **solve real world problems** while being able to face some of the challenges with developing software for an industry that isn't technologically progressive.

badges.name: Angular
badges.description:
Expanding knowledge of **Javascript web frameworks**.

 **MVC** and **MVVM** patterns.

 custom and prebuilt **angular components** (directives, services, filters, providers).

badges.name: Html 5 / CSS 3
badges.description:
Enriched my knowledge of modern web tools and methods.

**HTML5** components(geolocation, local storage, application cache).

**CSS3** components(animation/transitions, media queries, bootstrap 3).

badges.name: Git / Issue Tracking
badges.description:
Exposure to foundational skills with collaborative working using **Git** version control.

Experience using project issue tracking and managment tools such as  **Gitlab** and **Asana**.

badges.name: Raphael.js (svg)
badges.description:
Expand my previous knowledge of Flash animations with **SVG creation, animation and manipulation**.

Using the Raphael.js api for **javascript SVG** create 2D interfaces for manipulation of complex house plan dimensional information.

title: Investorist
heading: Investorist
about:
Investorist is a business to business marketplace for off the plan property.

For property professionals looking for software to forge relationahips between property agents and clients.

technology.description: The Investorist platform is built upon the ASP.NET applciation framework MVC 6 and deployed onto Microsoft Azure's cloud infastructure

badges.name: Microsoft ASP.NET
badges.description: ASP.NET MVC 6 web application

badges.name: Visual Studio
badges.description: Visual studio used for team managment and project tracking

badges.name: Html 5 / CSS 3
badges.description: Use of modern HTML5 features for best a great user experience

badges.name: Jquery
badges.description: Document traversal and manipulation library

achievements.description:
While working on Investorist and learning about Microsoft's interpretation of the MVC paradigm I developed a broader understanding of how the MVC architecture is used in a server-client relationship. Previously I only had exposure to angular, a complete MVC/MVVM framework on the client.

The traditional server-client model helped me appreciate some of the benefits of having a heavy-client (angular or otherwise) appliciation. This spurred interest in other view techniques such as react.js,  knockout.js and more.

badges.name: Microsoft ASP.NET
badges.description:
Experience with various aspects of **ASP.NET** web applciation framework.

MVC 6, Web API, Entity framework ORM wrapper, Razor view system

badges.name: Visual Studio
badges.description:
Increase my exposure to the microsoft ecosystem of tools for application managment and deployment.

**Team Foundation Server** source control

**Azure** application cloud hosting

badges.name: Jquery
badges.description: Extensive use of jquery **ajax calls** to create interactive web applications inside of the .cshtml Razor views.

title: Reverseasy
heading: Reverseasy
about: Currently in a staging environment, the new reverseasy website is for a ecommerce platform for a distributor of innovative automotive products as well as a market leader in sourcing and supplying specialised business tools to dealers in the Australian automotive industry.

technology.description: The Reverseasy website is built using the open source **Spree Commerce** content managment system built on top of the **Ruby on Rails** development framework. The Rails 4 framework has many structural and functional conventions that assist with developing clean websites. MVC, RESTful design, sass/scss preprocessor and an emphasis on modular design provide a strong base for the the Reverseasy website.

badges.name: Ruby on Rails
badges.description: Web application framework written in Ruby

badges.name: Html 5 / CSS 3
badges.description: Use of modern HTML5 features for best a great user experience

badges.name: Git
badges.description: Version control through Git hosted on private Gitlab insance

badges.name: Heroku
badges.description: Platform as a Service for 12-factor web apps

badges.name: Spree Commerce
badges.description: Open source ecommerce content managment system

achievements.description:
Working on the Reverseasy website was my first time using Ruby on rails for a software project. I found Ruby on rails a relativly straightforward framework to pick up considering my experience with MVC architecture in Angular and ASP.NET.

Handling the configuration and implementation of the reverseasy project has allowed me to also expand my experience with environment managment and tools such as heroku, kubernetes and docker for portable software deployments.

badges.name: Ruby on Rails
badges.description:
Familiarisation with the **Ruby on Rails** framework

Rails asset pipeline, application configuration and Spree commerce integration.

badges.name: Heroku
badges.description: Using **Heroku** application instance for staging environment.

badges.name: Hosting
badges.description:
Exploring **docker**, using compose and Dockerfiles to build easily reproducible environments.

Exploring **Amazon Web Services** and **Google Container Engine** for use as production environments.
